content: If I have 10 goals created by an rcases, is there a way to select only cases 3, 4, and 5 to work on at the same time while leaving the other goals alone? Since 3,4,5 can all be solved with the same tactics but I don't want to change the goal or hypotheses for any of the other goals
Does that let you work on multiple goals at once while excluding the others?

I suppose if each other goal required its own tactics, I could tackle each of those individually first and then address the three remaining goals at the end.

But what if there are two groups of goals, each of which can be solved with one set of tactics. Then I'd still need a way to select a group of goals

Hm ok I was expecting the tactics I run to work on both goals at once, but it only seems to run on the first one. Is there a way for me to make the tactics apply to the hypotheses and goal of both goals?

ok i made it work by using all_goals inside the combined case:

case first.goal.name | second.goal.name =>
  all_goals
    tactic1
    tactic2
    -- etc
aron has marked this topic as resolved.
